A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson has for the most part ruined the franchise\, and above all else shouldn't be handed the reins to the next trilogy.  \"(He) broke what could not be broken.  Hope is broken.\"  - Merlin.  I mean how can one screw this up?  This was gift wrapped for him.  Table set for \"character development\" success\, yet he turned it into a sideshow mockery of the original trilogy making Luke Skywalker out to be a total weak-minded bafoon save for a very few scenes like the final projection one.  Rian's take on the franchise would have been far better served by spending more time on the key characters\, background and Jedi storyline than wasting time on his Hitchcock McGuffin and trivial obsession with breaking away from the past.  What did George Lucas ever do to him?  I hope they get it right the next time.  Ron\, J.J.\, Disney\, are you reading this?
